title: "Ekko is an assassin who scales in long term skirmishes"
body:
First thing that makes no sense. Assassin or Teamfighting. You get to pick ONE.

Some examples: {{champion:105}} Kill person GTFO w/ pole. {{champion:38}} Rift in, wreck carry, Rift out. {{champion:121}} Jump in, make sure target is alone, delete their HP, hop the fuck out. {{champion:11}} Pray to god you don't get CC'd, because the second you do, you're fucked. {{champion:107}} Jump on carry, kill them, probably die because you have such strong damage Riot gave you no escape.  Even assassin's considered 'broken' by many people don't do well in teamfights. {{champion:238}} and {{champion:7}} sure can easily kill your carry and escape, but it's pretty unlikely that a non-fed as shit Zed or LeBlanc is going to kill multiple people.

Next thing we have is currently considered a huge issue with some assassins. The safety factor. Zed and LeBlanc are hated for it, Kha'Zix got gutted for about a month because of it. Kassadin has received a metric fuckton of changes because of his. Ekko has an "oops" button that costs no mana, heals, and does damage.

Mobility. "League of Legends isn't turning into an utter mobility fest." Yeah, let's give this guy a dash that can go through most walls, and then his next auto attack will blink to the target. Because fuck it.

Now what's the biggest thing that most assassins don't have, or have very little of? That's right, CC! Except Ekko! He gets a 2+ second AoE stun with a huge ass shield. He also gets a slow, which you will be forced to dodge all laning phase because it's pretty much a Nidalee spear that goes through targets but does *slightly* less damage.

Now quick, name a champion that should almost never lose lane, especially against a melee champion? That's, good ol' {{champion:58}}. Playing as Renekton, vs a **first time** Ekko, I barely won lane. Of course, he did get some ganks, but that's not the point. Nobody should have an easy time against Renekton. He is the epitome of fucking your lane phase up. Not Ekko's though, he just sits back, gets CS with Q, and as soon as you go in he throws down his slow/stun, dashes away, and then can always press his "oops" button if you try to tower dive him. The only times I was able to kill him (I didn't have ignite) was if I flash stunned or waited in a bush until he thought I backed.

Fuck this champion. Fuck this mobility creep. Next champion better have some sort of stupid ass anti mobility mechanic. Mobility creep is getting retarded. You'd think Riot would've stopped after dashing on every auto attack.

So because a skill is hard to hit, it should do a shitload of damage?

Tell that to {{champion:122}}  and {{champion:45}}

Lee Sin doesn't hit hard because he's hard to play, he just hits hard because that's how he's SUPPOSED to be, but he has counter play.  Ekko doesn't have an "almost everyone can do this" counter play.  Dodge his AoE shield/stun, and you still have his hard upfront burst to deal with, dodge his disc thing, same thing.  And his ult is incredibly overpowered.  Creating an "Oops" button is stupid.  At least Zilean's ult has a downside, in that even though it might heal a ton of damage, it doesn't matter much of the entire enemy team is standing on your body.  Ekko's ult allows him to jump back a huge distance, and if anyone is trying to predict that and stand near that point, he'll hit you for 500 damage PLUS 130% of his AP.  Where's the counterplay in that?

Counterplay only works if you can counterplay and still focus on farming.  His shit is so wonky and difficult to avoid that you spend almost all of laning phase just trying not to get hit by his disc and by this shield/stun.  Make the shield/stun balanced.  Shield only applies if an enemy champion is standing in the circle, and the stun is slightly lowered, plus make it so you can see the circle 1 second in advance, instead of .5.

Next, his phase dive should just allow him to jump forward and immediately attack, not flash and then jump forward.

His ult shouldn't heal NEARLY as much, and the AoE on it should be much smaller.  The damage is understandable if the AoE wasn't so large.  The whole point is, he's slippery to catch, and you shouldn't be punished for attempting to predict him.  If 3 people chase him and 2 of us stand back near his ult point, I shouldn't be bursted down for trying to predict it just because I was keeping myself within range of my abilities.

Did someone say "Oops"?

Let me take a second to explain why all of these champions don't have an oops button.

Zed - His ult puts him dead center of your team, if you're fast enough, you can stun him and all of his damage is completely gone, as he can't add damage to his ult's burst damage.

Fizz - has to choose between gap closing to you, or saving it to escape.

J4?  Seriously?  You think he has an oops button?  No one EVER saves their Flag jump for escaping.

Kat - Wait until she jumps into your team to ult, stun her, grats, even if she lives, she isn't escaping because she's on CD.

Kass - Have you seen the mana cost and CD on it?  You can use USUALLY 3 Riftwalks before you're out of mana.

Sej - Soooo.....what ability is an oops button again?

Trynd - Everyone uses E to gap close.        **_Everyone._**

Shaco - Hit him twice and he dies, and he has to choose between using Q to catch up with someone or saving it to escape.

Vlad - His W deals little damage, and takes a massive chunk of his health away.  I hardly consider that beneficial.  Hit W, and lose a ton of health, just so you can live, at which point if you're almost dead, you gotta B anyway.  Ekko doesn't.

Shyv - Again, what ability is an oops button?

LB - Has to choose between using her ult for damage or for an escape.

J4 - You really hate J4 don't you?

Nid - Hop is used to gap close, she can't burst people nearly as fast as most champs, hit her with a stun, and she's completely wrecked.

Now lets talk Ekko

He jumps in on your team, you stun him, nearly kill him, he spams ult, bam, back to where he was a few seconds ago with 60-80% of his health back, and 2-3 of your teammates wasted their ult.  Where is the choice in his ult again?  Your choice is this, burst them down with your kit and use your ult to escape, or burst them down with your kit and use your ult to burst everyone else down, at which point, he still can escape no problem.

70% slow on target with 70% buff to move speed on a PASSIVE?????  Seriously??????????????????????????

If Ekko survives the stun, he can R to get out.
Fizz can E
Zed can R
Lb can reactivate her W
Ahri should still have charges on her R
Vlad can W

Every single assassin has a way to get out if they survive the CC. That's a fact.

And yes, Ekko gives up lots of dmg to have his ult as an escape.
Q 280 +0.9
E 150 + 0.2
Passive 280 +0.7
Totally 720 + 1.8 which is lower than Ahri Q+W. If you dodge the return part of his Q, the entire combo goes down to 600 + 1.1.

I have to agree.

Talon has massive teamfight influence with great AoE on top of his ungodly ability to decide that one person in particular just doesn't get to play League that day. Armor can't save you from a Last Whisper + Rake and Shadow Assault, and he sure as hell isn't letting your carry get out alive without some actual focus.

Ekko is a lot closer to Talon than he is to other AP assassins like LeBlanc and Katarina, and that's not a bad thing, because he's just as susceptible to CC, and can be very easily forced to use his ult to escape a bad situation instead of nuking his target. They're having a problem taking advantage of that, but I feel like they just need to get used to playing against him.
Dont forget Talon has a crappy Early, cant trade before lvl 4 at all and has no escape if he wants to actually kill his enemy. Oh, and also note that Talons passive is a little bit weaker than Ekkos.

Ekko's pre-6 is extremely abusable, his trading requires he either run out of mana trying to spam Q or get in melee range for his passive (and his Timewinder is a much slower spell than Talon's Rake, meaning it's even easier to avoid), and Ekko's only reliable escape is also his AoE nuke. Just like Talon, it's also very easy to force Ekko to use Timewinder to waveclear pre-6 without taking any harass from it.

I won't argue that Talon's passive is stronger than Ekko's—it isn't, because Ekko's passive has great base damage and insane scaling for a 3-hit mechanic that procs on both autoattacks and every hit from his abilities. (Maybe if Timewinder could only proc one stack, like Gnar's boomerang, it would be more reasonable, even if the damage didn't change. The simple requirement of needing to not only Phase Dive in, but to get off a second basic attack to take advantage of his passive, could be massive.)

However, Ekko and Talon share quite a lot of their weaknesses and strengths, much more than any other assassins do.

90 % of the Ekkos I've seen wait until they hit first part of Timewinder, then jump in as early as lvl 2, and then run away with the passive while having half-lifed the enemy. Once he gets his W, it's almost impossible to outtrade him if he's any good. Not to mention Talon's W is almost negligible in terms of damage before Rank 2-3.

Also, Ekko can easily kill enemies without his ult with only a Sheen, as he can stick to target way easier than Talon, who needs at least Tiamat or Brutalizer and both parts of his ult.

Champs like Yi, Ekko, Riven, and Kassadin aren't really assassins OR teamfighters.

They're skirmishers/light fighters. They excel in small fights: 1v1s up to 3v3s, away from lanes and in the jungle. They aren't that good in lane sieges or in big 5v5 brawls at baron until they get fed.

Excuse me, but are you still playing League of Legends?

No champion can 100-0 anyone unless they're way ahead, but come on.  I've seen Zed with 2 kills who struggles to 100-0 some people who aren't all that tanky.  Ekko, this isn't the case, he can have ONE kill because of a small mistake you made, gets a little AP, and suddenly you're trying your best to just stay under turret and not get hit by all his shit.

3 seconds to pop an ability that you can't see where it's going, so chances are you're gonna have to change directions, in doing so, he simply gets closer to you, then pops phase dive, and grats he's STILL on you. 

But wait, you somehow are 1v1ing him without any serious issue, OOOOO HE'S ALMOST DEAD!  ANNNND....."OOPS!" suddenly he's back at 50% health and he just did huge damage to you with his ult.

Add to it, the INSANE shield he gets, 690 shield at level 5 with 490 AP, you essentially just took this "Fragile assassin" and made him beefy enough to live against almost anyone in a 1v1 fight.

BUT WAIT, THERE'S MORE

Max out your CDR and suddenly you can 1v1 people, assassinate targets, AND team fight!

The only thing they didn't add in that could have made him more OP is ability resets on kill.

If you HONESTLY believe that Ekko is in no way shape or form OP, then you are probably one of the people who play him and don't wanna see him get nerfed.
